docs.abstract: Forget fad diets and fitness gimmicks. Just stick to the basics.
docs.snippet: Forget fad diets and fitness gimmicks. Just stick to the basics.
docs.lead_paragraph: Daytime television talk shows, popular podcasts and diet books on the New York Times best-seller list would have you believe that being healthy is complicated. You need to eat the latest superfood, buy the perfect supplements or join the hippest fitness cult. These theories are particularly popular right now, as people commit to New Year’s resolutions.

headline.main: How to Be Healthy, in Just 48 Words

docs.abstract: Linda Tracy and Peter Tracy had been married 37 years, before divorcing in 2015. When their sons began planning their own weddings, Mom and Dad rediscovered love.
docs.snippet: Linda Tracy and Peter Tracy had been married 37 years, before divorcing in 2015. When their sons began planning their own weddings, Mom and Dad rediscovered love.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Donna Adelsberg ran into her best friend’s ex-husband  at the supermarket a few years ago, she intended to leave him standing by the deli with his pastrami and her cold shoulder.

headline.print_headline: A Love So Persistent, They Had to Marry Twice

docs.abstract: Increases in minimum wages across the country may make the labor market look a bit rosier than it really is.
docs.snippet: Increases in minimum wages across the country may make the labor market look a bit rosier than it really is.
docs.lead_paragraph: These days, wages in the United States are doing something extraordinary: They’re growing faster at the bottom than at the top. In fact, recent growth for workers with low wages has outpaced that for high-wage workers by the widest margin in at least 20 years.

headline.main: Pay Is Rising Fastest for Low Earners. One Reason? Minimum Wages.
headline.print_headline: Wages Rise At Low End, Gilding Data

docs.abstract: Fires continue to rage in southeast Australia. If you’re safe, we would like to hear from residents and tourists and see your photos or videos.
docs.snippet: Fires continue to rage in southeast Australia. If you’re safe, we would like to hear from residents and tourists and see your photos or videos.
docs.lead_paragraph: As wildfires continue to devastate southeast Australia, thousands of residents and tourists have evacuated. The fires, fed by strong winds and triple-digit temperatures, have killed at least 18 people and destroyed more than 1,000 homes and millions of acres of land.

headline.main: How Have Australia’s Wildfires Affected You?

docs.abstract: The remaining candidates should emulate his fighting words — and try to win him to their side.
docs.snippet: The remaining candidates should emulate his fighting words — and try to win him to their side.
docs.lead_paragraph: Julián Castro is the latest Democrat to drop out of the 2020 presidential race. He will probably receive more press coverage today and tomorrow than he has on any other day since he announced his candidacy. But unlike other Democrats who have thrown in the towel, Mr. Castro should continue to have a significant impact on the presidential campaign.

headline.main: Julián Castro Is Worth More Out of the Presidential Race Than He Was in It
headline.print_headline: Julián Castro Is Worth More Out of the Race Than In

docs.abstract: Israeli intelligence had long tracked the Iranian commander whose shadow loomed ever larger and closer.
docs.snippet: Israeli intelligence had long tracked the Iranian commander whose shadow loomed ever larger and closer.
docs.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — For years, he was a distant adversary, overseeing attacks on Israeli and Jewish targets abroad. But as time went on, the threat from Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani loomed ever larger and closer for Israel.

headline.main: Israel Lauds Suleimani Assassination, Though With Caution

docs.abstract: On the first day of a new legislative session, Senate leaders indicated they had made no progress in resolving their logjam over how to proceed.
docs.snippet: On the first day of a new legislative session, Senate leaders indicated they had made no progress in resolving their logjam over how to proceed.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate leaders wrangled on Friday over the terms of President Trump’s impeachment trial, deepening their impasse and throwing the start date further into doubt amid disputes over whether to call witnesses or introduce documentary evidence.

headline.main: Impeachment Impasse Deepens in Senate, Leaving Trump’s Trial in Doubt
headline.print_headline: No Progress on Rules for an Impeachment Trial

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry

docs.abstract: Plus: Taking notes on Grandma’s love life.
docs.snippet: Plus: Taking notes on Grandma’s love life.
docs.lead_paragraph: [Sign up here to receive Love Letter, a weekly newsletter about relationship highs, lows and woes, in your inbox every Friday.]

headline.main: Love Letter: A Divorced Couple Remarries

docs.abstract: In the current political climate, humor, of course, is not the only thing affected by the government.
docs.snippet: In the current political climate, humor, of course, is not the only thing affected by the government.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — I was born over 30 years ago, just as democracy in Brazil was emerging. Yes, Brazilian democracy is the same age as Lindsay Lohan. Like her, it had its heyday in the 2000s and didn’t fare well with the onset of adulthood.

headline.main: Bolsonaro Doesn’t Deserve the Nickname ‘Trump of the Tropics.’ (Not Even That!)

docs.abstract: Friday: Here are your new rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act. Also: A look at the Chase Center, and Golden Globes predictions.
docs.snippet: Friday: Here are your new rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act. Also: A look at the Chase Center, and Golden Globes predictions.

headline.main: How California’s New Privacy Law Affects You

byline.original: By Jill Cowan and Natasha Singer
